{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3625693,"name":"Tim McMahon","username":"t_McMahon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/f1d935/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-16T00:22:31.766Z","cooked":"

When determining distance to an april tag with photonvision you read the pitch to the tag via photonvision. You can then determine distance knowing the height of the april tag.

How do you measure height of april tag? Floor to bottom of tag? Floor to center of tag?

I assume this all depends on the point to where photonvision is measuring the pitch.

Many teams do full pose estimation- getting the robot pose in 3D mode, then using that pose to get a distance from the tag or another POI.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-05-16T00:41:44.698Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":27.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":501841,"topic_slug":"distance-to-april-tag-using-photonvision","display_username":"Graham Howard","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57939,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"frctools.com"},"post_url":"/t/distance-to-april-tag-using-photonvision/501841/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3625869,"name":"paulonis","username":"paulonis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5fc32e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-16T03:15:16.325Z","cooked":"

If you have a calibrated camera and can get 3D results, for an individual tag being returned as a PhotonTrackedTarget, you can find the camera-to-tag straight-line distance with:

target.bestCameraToTarget.getTranslation().getNorm()

If you want distance to a specific point on the robot, you can add a Transform3D of robot-to-camera to bestCameraToTarget so you end up with a robot-to-tag transformation and then get the translation and norm of that.

If you are trying to get distance using trig and the 2D pitch, PhotonVision is going to return the pitch to the center of the AprilTag. There is a Target Offset Point setting in the Output for AprilTag configuration which defaults to Center, but I don’t think changing this setting does anything in an AprilTag pipeline. The pitch angle originates at the center of the camera sensor. The pitch angle is also relative to the pitch of the camera, so be sure to add the camera pitch if it is not parallel to the floor. You can do trig where the triangle side opposite the angle is the height of the center of the AprilTag minus the height of the center of the camera sensor. You can then compute either the hypotenuse or adjacent side of the triangle depending on whether you want 2D or 3D distance and then further modify that distance if you want to make it relative to some point on the robot other than the center of the camera sensor.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-05-16T03:21:43.426Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":25.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":501841,"topic_slug":"distance-to-april-tag-using-photonvision","display_username":"paulonis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22261,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/distance-to-april-tag-using-photonvision/501841/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3625880,"name":"Steven Carmain","username":"Steven_Carmain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/f07891/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-16T03:33:41.714Z","cooked":"

We use distance to AprilTag in camera calibration to make sure the camera looks correct. We always do it in code though. You get a tranform3d from PhotonVision, then it’s just x^2+y^2+z^2, then sqrt. (Or getNorm() I guess)

I would not trust the numbers from PhotonVision Web GUI unless you are doing a vertical mounted camera to a vertical tag. Any angle more than a little means the right triangle the PhotonVision web GUI shows includes a triangle rotation, and the distance in X (robot center to tag, front to back direction, not left/right) then goes through a wall.

I recommend doing the distance formula method dealing with any tag/camera mount not parallel to each other (both tag and camera vertical). We had an issue where our vision would randomly go between 2-8” off, worse the further we went. It was because we had the wrong sign for pitch angle. Correcting the sign, we could measure center of tag to center of camera to 1” at any distance 1-3.5m.

Edit: While always calculated, we only use the distance formula for calibration purposes. Please use the Pose Estimators for general field location, as they are strong and robust.

Steven_Carmain:

You get a translation3d from PhotonVision, then it’s just x^2+y^2+z^2, then sqrt.

or getNorm which returns the same thing.
